meanings.definition: Feeling or showing the most intense fear or anxiety.
meanings.sent1: She was the panickiest person in the haunted house, screaming at every shadow.
meanings.sent2: During the storm, he became the panickiest of all his friends, constantly checking the weather forecast.
meanings.sent3: The panickiest squirrel in the park kept running in circles around the tree, mistaking falling leaves for predators.
meanings.sent4: Her heart raced like the panickiest horse at the starting line, ready to bolt at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The panickiest moment of the movie was when the protagonist realized they were trapped in a dark room with no way out.

meanings.definition: In a state of extreme fear or anxiety.
meanings.sent1: The panickiest cat in the shelter hid under the bed, trembling at the slightest noise.
meanings.sent2: After getting lost in the unfamiliar neighborhood, she felt the panickiest she had ever felt.
meanings.sent3: The panickiest puppy at the vet's office tried to hide behind its owner's legs, thinking the thermometer was a toy.
meanings.sent4: The panickiest moment of the play was when the lights went out unexpectedly, leaving the audience in complete darkness.
meanings.sent5: His breathing quickened, and he felt the panickiest sensation creeping up his spine as he realized he was alone in the abandoned house.
